Additionally, domains currently or previously used as extensions in 3rd level domains will not be available for registration in the 2nd level. observation: [{'url': 'https://www.magnifymoney.com/investing/stock-scams/', 'content': 'This type of scam offers the chance to buy so-called hot stocks ahead of the IPO. While there are legitimate offers to buy shares before an IPO, unregistered offerings may violate federal securities laws unless they meet a so-called registration exemption by only being offered to investors who meet income and net worth requirements.'}, {'url': 'https://news.trendmicro.com/2021/03/05/investment-scams-what-they-are-and-tips-to-avoid-them/', 'content': 'Advance-fee Scam. Scammers ask for an upfront fee, commission, or other expense before you can participate in the investment. They claim that the money is necessary to "guarantee your place" or that it will be "paid back later.". Once scammers have your money, they will disappear with the cash, and you will be left with nothing.'}, {'url': 'https://theblogsocieties.com/6-ways-to-spot-a-blogging-scam/', 'content': "These are automated emails that are sent to the masses. 5. They Ask You to Buy Something. If a brand came to you requesting you purchase something, there's no way it can be legitimate. Reputable brands have a budget to provide free products for campaigns or gift cards. 6. Trust Your Gut."}, {'url': 'https://www.malwarebytes.com/blog/news/2022/02/investment-scams-are-on-the-rise', 'content': "Investment scams are on the rise. Preying on one of the most basic human flaws, investment scams and other get-rich-quick schemes are making up an ever larger portion of the online scammers' cake. The number of victims, for now, is lower than the number of victims of fraudulent sales, identity fraud, and dating fraud, but the cost of ..."}, {'url': 'https://www.investright.org/news-and-insights/fraud-articles/dont-fall-for-these-four-investment-scams-in-2022/', 'content': "Report a Concern. If you have any concerns about a person or company offering an investment opportunity, please contact BCSC Contact Centre at 604-899-6854 or 1-800-373-6393 or through e-mail at inquiries@bcsc.bc.ca . You can also file a complaint or submit a tip anonymously using the BCSC's online complaint form."}]
